page.title: 02View from Mow Cop
page.content: From the castle it is possible to see spectacular views in all directions.If we look north west we see the Cheshire plain stretching before us,a patch work of fields,dotted here and there with trees and small woods.On a clear day the Welsh hills can be seen.One prominent feature that can be seen is the radio telescope at Jodrell Bank. To the south west can be seen the town of Kidsgrove with the buildings of the pottery towns in the distance.To the east you can see the town of Biddulph, nestling in the valley, with the ridge rising again to Biddulph moor.Behind this is the higher mountains of the Peak district.
